properties.Name: AssetSalvageValue
properties.Description:
The anticipated or expected price for a fixed asset no longer needed in business operations, which is also known as 'scrap value' as of a specific date.

In determining depreciation expense, salvage value is subtracted from cost.

SALVAGE VALUE is: a) Realizable value of a fixed asset after deducting costs associated with its sale; b) Scrap value or the value to a junk dealer; or c) The amount remaining after all depreciation has been deducted from the original cost of a depreciable asset.

Columns.Name: AssetId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of an Asset.

Columns.Name: Date
Columns.Description: The date that the salvage value of the asset is determined.

Columns.Name: SalvageValueAmount
Columns.Description: The salvage value of the asset as of the associated date.

Columns.Name: SalvageNote
Columns.Description: Notes, comments or additional information regarding the asset salvage value.
